title: New Year's Day
text: January 1, celebrating in the United States the first day of the first month on the Gregorian calendar.

title: Martin Luther King Jr. Day
text: Honors the famous American civil rights leader who dedicated his life to achieving equality for people of all colors.

title: President's Day
text: Presidents' Day, officially Washington's Birthday, is a holiday in the United States celebrated on the third Monday of February to honor all persons who served in the office of president of the United States.

title: Memorial Day
text: Memorial Day is a federal holiday in the United States for mourning the U.S. military personnel who have died while serving in the United States armed forces. It is observed on the last Monday of May.

title: Juneteenth (Observed)
text: Juneteenth is a federal holiday in the United States commemorating the emancipation of African-American slaves.

title: July 4th.
text: Independence Day is a federal holiday in the United States commemorating the Declaration of Independence of the United States, on July 4, 1776.

title: Labor Day
text: Labor Day is a federal holiday in the United States celebrated on the first Monday in September to honor and recognize the American labor movement and the works and contributions of laborers to the development and achievements of the United States.

title: Indigenous People's Day
text: Indigenous Peoples' Day is a holiday in the United States that celebrates and honors Native American peoples and commemorates their histories and cultures.

title: Veterans Day
text: Veterans Day is a federal holiday in the United States observed annually on November 11, for honoring military veterans of the United States Armed Forces.

title: Thanksgiving
text: In 1789, President George Washington proclaimed Nov. 26, 1789 as the first nation-wide day of Thanksgiving, marking the event as a time of public prayer.

title: Day After Thanksgiving
text: An American holiday celebrated by sitting on the couch in a food coma.

title: Christmas Eve
text: Celebrating the evening before Christmas Day which celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ

title: Christmas Day
text: A Christian holiday

title: New Years Eve
text: The last day of the year which Americans reflect back over the past year and look forward to the new year.
